alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Forsyth, northwestern Davidson and northwestern Guilford Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Oregon Hill to near King to Courtney. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Kernersville, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Lewisville, Summerfield, Stokesdale, Walkertown, Rural Hall and Pfafftown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
